hint: Starts with S. 10 letters. Topic: licensedtonikitasrivastavapmimemberid8931035, uncontrolled, adjustments.
meaning: Refers to uncontrolled expansion to product or project scope without adjustments to time, cost, and resources. LicensedTo:NikitaSrivastavaPMIMemberID:8931035

hint: Starts with S. 18 letters. Topic: cross-functional, leadership, objectives.
meaning: Refers to cross-functional team in which people assume leadership as needed to achieve the team’s objectives.

hint: Starts with S. 13 letters. Topic: deliverable, attribute, necessary.
meaning: Refers to attribute that is necessary to be present in a project deliverable to help meet or exceed a target business objective.

hint: Starts with S. 7 letters. Topic: accountable, individual, resources.
meaning: Refers to individual or a group that provides resources and support for the portfolio, program, or project, and is accountable for enabling success.

hint: Starts with S. 6 letters. Topic: potentially, releasable, timeboxed.
meaning: Refers to timeboxed interval within a project during which a usable and potentially releasable increment of a product is created.

hint: Starts with S. 11 letters. Topic: organization, individual, portfolio.
meaning: Refers to individual, group, or organization that may affect, be affected by, or perceive itself to be affected by a decision, task, or outcome of a portfolio, program, or project.

hint: Starts with S. 8 letters. Topic: established, authority, document.
meaning: Refers to document established by an authority, custom, or general consent as a model or example.

hint: Starts with S. 18 letters. Topic: description, narrative, delivered.
meaning: Refers to narrative description of products, services, or results to be delivered by the project.

hint: Starts with S. 13 letters. Topic: information, performance, regularly.
meaning: Refers to regularly scheduled meeting to exchange and analyze information about the current progress of the project and its performance.

hint: Starts with S. 17 letters. Topic: stakeholders, direction, portfolio.
meaning: Refers to advisory body of senior stakeholders who provide direction and support for the portfolio, program, or project team and make decisions outside of the team’s authority.

hint: Starts with S. 10 letters. Topic: implement, estimate, relative.
meaning: Refers to unit used to forecast the relative level of effort needed to implement a user story.

hint: Starts with S. 13 letters. Topic: organizations, high-level, objectives.
meaning: Refers to high-level document that explains an organization’s vision and mission plus the approach that will be adopted to achieve this mission and vision, including the specific goals and objectives to be achieved…

hint: Starts with S. 5 letters. Topic: collectively, resolving, multiple.
meaning: Refers to method in which multiple team members focus collectively on resolving a specific problem or task.

hint: Starts with T. 14 letters. Topic: articulate, experience, knowledge.
meaning: Personal knowledge that can be difficult to articulate and share such as beliefs, experience, and insights.

hint: Starts with T. 9 letters. Topic: environment, deliberate, adaptation.
meaning: Refers to deliberate adaptation of approach, governance, and processes to make them more suitable for the given environment and the work at hand.

hint: Starts with T. 9 letters. Topic: representation, progress, everyone.
meaning: Refers to visual representation of the progress of the planned work that allows everyone to see the status of the tasks.

hint: Starts with T. 28 letters. Topic: quantifiable, requirements, performance.
meaning: Quantifiable measures of technical performance that are used to ensure system components meet the technical requirements.

hint: Starts with T. 8 letters. Topic: information, predefined, collecting.
meaning: Refers to partially complete document in a predefined format that provides a defined structure for collecting, organizing, and presenting information and data.

hint: Starts with T. 6 letters. Topic: objectives, portfolio, negative.
meaning: Refers to risk that would have a negative effect on one or more portfolio, program, or project objectives.

hint: Starts with T. 9 letters. Topic: predetermined, measurable, represents.
meaning: Refers to predetermined value of a measurable project variable that represents a limit that requires action to be taken if it is reached.

hint: Starts with T. 10 letters. Topic: licensedtonikitasrivastavapmimemberid8931035, passing, through.
meaning: Refers to number of items passing through a process. LicensedTo:NikitaSrivastavaPMIMemberID:8931035

hint: Starts with T. 26 letters. Topic: cost-reimbursable, contractual, arrangement.

hint: Starts with T. 7 letters. Topic: completed, period, short.
meaning: Refers to short, fixed period of time in which work is to be completed.

hint: Starts with T. 9 letters. Topic: description, requirement, quantified.
meaning: Refers to quantified description of acceptable variation for a quality requirement.

hint: Starts with T. 16 letters. Topic: considering, perspective, evaluating.

hint: Starts with U. 11 letters. Topic: understanding, awareness, solutions.

hint: Starts with V. 10 letters. Topic: stakeholders, identified, assurance.

hint: Starts with V. 19 letters. Topic: organization, collection, activities.

hint: Starts with V. 16 letters. Topic: organization, communicates, customers.

hint: Starts with V. 12 letters. Topic: information, decisions, measure.

hint: Starts with V. 10 letters. Topic: unpredictable, possibility, change.
